title: What are the differences between sleeping and hibernating? - Quora

response.answer_text: Sleeping occurs for short periods of time and occurs regularly or say daily whereas hibernation occurs for longer period of time and is seasonal… Although both the activities are performed to save energy but hibernating is like becoming half dead…when the animal hibernates it is only their respiration which is going on otherwise it is almost dead,no movement, no searching for food,no reproduction and etc processes… Let us say sleeping is a natural process whereas hibernation is an adaptation to survive from harsh environmental and seasonal conduction… In short hibertion is a long-term sleep …

Both serve the same purpose, “To save energy”. But hibernating is a longer process of conserving energy where the body enters a deep sleep state. Whereas, sleeping is just a small state, well its purpose is rather to help the body to relax after a certain amount of workdone(slow stress build up which needs to released)
